intro: Beloperone meyeniana, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are upright and branching. Beloperone meyeniana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate blooms.
